incidents.name: Spaces Object Uploading/Downloading through Cloud Control Panel

incident_updates.body:
Our Engineering team has confirmed full resolution of this incident. 

From approximately 18:00 - 19:00 UTC, users were unable to upload or download objects in the control panel for Spaces buckets in all regions. 

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

Our Engineering team identified the root cause of the issue impacting Spaces object uploads and downloads in the Cloud Control Panel and has reverted the breaking change. Users should now be able to use Spaces normally. 

We will continue to monitor the situation to ensure stability and provide a final update once we confirm the issue has been fully resolved. 

Thank you again for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Our Engineering team is investigating reports of an issue with uploading and downloading objects to and from Spaces buckets in the Cloud Control Panel, for all regions. User reports indicate this issue began around 18:00 UTC. 

At this time, functionality via the Spaces API does not appear to be impacted. 

We are working to confirm details of this issue and will provide an update as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Spaces CDN Certificate and Load Balancer creates in AMS3 and SGP1

incident_updates.body:
As of 03:45 UTC, Our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue which impacted Spaces CDN certificates in AMS3 and SGP1 regions.

If you should experience any further issues, please open a ticket with our support team right away. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Our engineering team has renewed the expired SSL certificates on the Spaces CDN in AMS3 and SGP1 regions. Users should no longer experience any errors when accessing the objects using the CDN endpoint. 

We are now monitoring Spaces traffic to ensure this fix has mitigated all impacts and will post an update as soon as we confirm that is the case. Thank you for your patience!

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with the SSL certificates on the Spaces CDN in AMS3 and SGP1. These certificates expired at 00:00 UTC, causing users to see SSL warnings when accessing objects. The team is now in the process of rolling forward to new certificates, which will mitigate this issue. 

Our team previously believed Load Balancer creations to be impacted due to a dependency, but has confirmed they are not impacted. All Load Balancer creations should be succeeding normally. 

We will post an update once the new certificates are in place.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with the SSL certificate on the Spaces CDN in our AMS3 and SGP1 regions.
 
During this time, users with Spaces buckets not using a custom SSL certificate with the CDN will see SSL errors while viewing objects. 

Due to a dependency on the Spaces CDN, users may also see slow or failed creates for Load Balancers.

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

incidents.name: Subsea Fiber Faults in the APAC region

incident_updates.body:
Our Engineering team has continued to actively monitor the situation resulting from multiple subsea fiber faults in the APAC region. Over the last ten days, network connectivity on routes from Singapore to San Francisco and Singapore to Europe has not experienced any major packet loss or latency. Network routes to and from Bangalore also have not experienced any major packet loss or latency. Crews have been able to complete some cable repairs, leading to the stability for the routes mentioned. 

Our team is still observing daily packet loss and latency on network routes between Singapore and New York City, as well as Singapore and Toronto. These are normally short-lived and happen during Singapore business hours when traffic is heavy. 

Repair of all cables from crews is still pending and may continue for multiple weeks. Given the relative stability of routes, we will now close out this incident and provide any needed updates separately. 

If users experience a disruption in service or have any questions, we invite them to submit a support ticket from within their account. 

Thank you for your patience and understanding throughout this incident.

Around 07:00 UTC, we saw a small period of increased loss, due to increased traffic and congestion in the APAC region. This self-recovered and since then, we have not seen further periods of decreased performance.  About two hours later, we experienced an unrelated issue in BLR1, details of which can be found here: https://status.digitalocean.com/incidents/zdd6830qvvzx. We originally believed the impact in BLR1 to be due to this incident, but confirmed it was a separate issue. We apologize for any confusion.

As a reminder, we expect periods of increased loss and latency to continue to occur, but they are normally short-lived, and most happen during APAC business hours due to increased traffic and congestion.

We continue to await the fiber fault repairs and make traffic routing changes when available for better performance. We expect the situation to continue to improve over the coming month as crews continue and complete work.

Between 10:20 - 11:10 UTC, we experienced an uptick in loss and latency in the APAC region, due to a downstream effect of this incident. During this time, we saw a slight dip in public API availability, meaning a small subset of users may have experienced errors while sending requests. Users would have also seen loss and latency on Droplets and Droplet-based services in the APAC region. 

Periods of increased loss and latency continue to occur, but are normally short-lived, and most happen during APAC business hours due to increased traffic and congestion. 

We continue to await the fiber fault repairs and make traffic routing changes when available for better performance. We expect the situation to continue to improve over the coming month as crews continue and complete work.

Our Engineering team has observed recurring incidents that are continuing to affect our customers' resources in the APAC region. As a result, some users may be experiencing packet loss and increased latency in this area. Our team is actively monitoring the situation and implementing traffic routing changes where applicable to alleviate the congestion. 

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and will provide updates as the situation progresses.

The situation with network performance in the APAC region has continually improved in the past few weeks as repairs have progressed and traffic optimization to route around affected paths has continued. We have now been observing normal latency and zero packet loss for a few days, so we will move this incident to a Monitoring state for a few days. If the improvements we’ve seen continue, we’ll look to close this out and provide any further updates separately. Thank you for your patience as this situation unfolded and our Network Engineering team worked around it.

Our Engineering team continues to monitor network performance in the APAC region and make routing changes as needed to alleviate performance concerns. 

Customers are still experiencing periodic performance and connectivity issues and will continue to experience those issues until restoration efforts are completed by upstream providers for the undersea cable cuts (fiber faults) in the APAC region.

Full repair is expected to take multiple weeks. We will continue to communicate any updates we receive.

Our Engineering team is continuing to take actions to mitigate customer impact and monitor the ongoing issues with network connectivity in the APAC region. Performance has been relatively stable as traffic is slowly increasing across the rerouted network. However, some customers may still experience periodic performance and connectivity issues until restoration efforts are completed by the upstream providers.

We have no ETA for the upstream issue being completely resolved, but we will continue to communicate any relevant information as soon as it is available to us. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has made routing changes for some traffic to work around the congestion caused by multiple subsea fiber faults in the APAC region. We are slowly ramping up traffic on this new route and are carefully monitoring for the next 24 hours. 

While this new route is expected to help ease some of the packet loss and latency from the APAC region fiber faults, we expect some users to still experience performance and connectivity drops until the faults are resolved.

We have no ETA for the upstream issues being restored but we will communicate any relevant information as we have it. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Our Engineering team continues to monitor the ongoing issue with multiple subsea fiber faults in the APAC region. We have experienced multiple periods of packet loss and increased latency and expect to continue to see those until the issue is resolved upstream. Our team will continue observing performance and making traffic routing changes where applicable/available to work around the congestion. 

While we have no ETA for the faults being restored, we will communicate updates as we have them. If you have questions or concerns about impacted services from this incident, we ask that you open a Support ticket from within your account. Thank you!

Our Engineering team is continuing to work with upstream providers to fix the network connectivity issues we are experiencing in the SGP1 region. The problems appear to be a direct result of multiple subsea fiber faults in the APAC region causing congestion resulting in packet loss and increased latency connecting to the SGP1 region.

At this time users will continue experiencing intermittent timeout errors with Droplet-based services in the SGP1 region. We do not have a firm ETA for resolution time but we will provide updates as needed. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our team is continuing to work on a fix for this issue. We will provide an update in the due course along with more information about this problem. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.

As of 12:00 UTC, our Engineering team has again identified an issue with an upstream provider causing packet loss and increased latency in the SGP1 region. Users may have been experiencing degraded performance including timeout errors with Droplet-based services in SGP1. Please note that the concerned team is actually working on a fix and we will share an update once we have further information.

As of 21:34 UTC, Our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue with our App Platform and Container Registry services has been fully resolved. All operations should now be operating normally with these services. If you continue to experience any trouble with these services please open a ticket with our support team. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

As of 20:44 UTC, Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with our App Platform and Container Registry services and is monitoring the situation closely. 

Users should no longer see any issues while pushing their images to their container registries and App Platform users shouldn't experience any build failures.

We are going to continue to monitor the situation and will post an update once we are confident this issue will not recur.

As of 19:09 UTC, our Engineering team has identified an issue with DigitalOcean Container Registry and App Platform. At this time, users may experience slow responses or errors while interacting and authenticating with the DigitalOcean Container Registry, creating new container registries, and pushing/deleting images to/from registries. Users may also experience issues with App Platform deploys and creates failing. 

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 00:00 UTC, Our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue which impacted our Cloud Control Panel, API and DigitalOcean webpages. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

Since 20:41 UTC, our Engineering team has not observed any further recurrences of the issue. We did experience a brief outage with marketplace.digitalocean.com, but the mitigation efforts completed appear to have been successful. We are going to continue to monitor the situation and will post an update once we are confident this issue will not recur.

Our Engineering team has observed multiple mitigation strategies resulting in lessening error rates for our Cloud Control Panel and API. At this time, we expect the majority of users to be able to access cloud.digitalocean.com and send API requests normally. Based on the recurrences we've observed so far, there may still be intermittent periods of failures until the situation is fully resolved.

Thank you for your patience.

Some mitigation strategies have been put into place and we are also working with our upstream partners to continue to resolve the issue with our Cloud Control Panel and API. If users are experiencing errors while accessing cloud.digitalocean.com, we recommend logging out and back in to refresh their session. 

We will post another update as soon as we have further information to share.

Multiple teams continue to work to mitigate the impact from this incident and restore stability to cloud.digitalocean.com and our public API. Users will continue to see intermittent timeouts and errors for requests to the Cloud Control Panel and API. Please note that users may also see issues accessing subdomains of digitalocean.com, such as status.digitalocean.com, but may refresh pages to attempt to view them successfully. 

We will post another update within the next 15 minutes.

We are experiencing recurrences of the earlier issue from today, impacting our Cloud Control Panel and API. You can find the previous incident details here: https://status.digitalocean.com/incidents/flx6d2q5v0zz 

Our Engineering team is engaged and working on mitigating this now. At this time, users may intermittently be unable to access cloud.digitalocean.com, as well as send requests to the public API. 

We will post an update with further information as soon as possible.

Our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of this issue, which impacted our Cloud Control Panel, API and DigitalOcean webpages. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

As of 12:45 UTC, our Engineering team identified an issue with the Cloud Control Panel and some other DigitalOcean webpages. Users were unable to reach cloud.digitalocean.com and may have experienced issues while trying to reach other DigitalOcean sites. API requests were also impacted and as a result of this incident and users may have seen API failures during this time. 

The impact appears to be subsided around 13:00 UTC and are now monitoring the situation. We will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team identified an issue impacting Spaces availability in our NYC3 region from 18:00 - 18:10 UTC. During that time, all requests to Spaces buckets in NYC3 failed and users may have seen connection timeouts or other errors. Users attempting to create new Spaces buckets via the Cloud Control Panel or Spaces API would have also experienced errors. 

Our team identified the issue and performed an immediate rollback, mitigating the situation. As of 18:10 UTC, all requests and bucket creations were succeeding once more.

We apologize for the delayed notice and disruption in service. If you have any questions or concerns, please open a support ticket from within your account.

As of 07:28 UTC, our Engineering team has resolved the issue with Droplet creation events across all regions. The Droplet creations should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team. We apologize for any inconvenience

Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with processing Droplet creation events across all regions and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with processing Droplet creation events across all regions and is actively working on a fix. During this time users may experience latencies or failed events when creating Droplets. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

As of 05:00 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating an issue with processing Droplet creation events across all regions. During this time users may experience latencies or failed events when creating Droplets. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 08:35 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue that impacted network reachability in the SGP1 region. All services and resources should now be fully reachable.
If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.
Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the network connectivity issue in the SGP1 region and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue impacting multiple products in the SGP1 region and is actively working on a fix. During this time, users may still experience packet loss/latency, timeouts, and related issues with Droplet-based services in these regions, including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available

As of 06:40 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting multiple products in the SGP1 region. During this time, a subset of users may have experienced packet loss/latency, timeouts, and related issues with Droplet-based services in this region, including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database. We will share an update once we have further information.

Our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting our Managed Database product has been fully resolved. If you continue to experience any issues while creating Managed Database clusters please open a ticket with our support team. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering team has deployed a fix for the issue impacting our Managed Database product.

As of 18:05 UTC, all impact has been mitigated and users should no longer experience any issues with creating Managed Database clusters. Existing users who already have a Managed Database cluster might have experienced errors if they have tried creating a Managed Database cluster on a newly created team account.
 
We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once the incident is completely resolved.

As of 17:10 UTC, our Engineering team has identified the issue impacting our Managed Database product and is working on a fix. In the meantime, new users may experience errors while creating Managed Database clusters. Users who already have a Managed Database cluster are not impacted by this incident.

Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with our Managed Database product. At this time, new users may experience errors while creating clusters, both via Cloud Control Panel and API requests.

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

Our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting our Help Center has been fully resolved. If you continue to experience any issues in relation to this incident please open a ticket with our support team. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering team has deployed a fix for the issue impacting our Help Center.

As of 14:10 UTC, all impact has been mitigated and users should no longer experience any issues with updating existing tickets. We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once the incident is completely resolved.

Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with customers being unable to update existing tickets on our help center at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/

At this time, a subset of users may observe an error on the page. As a temporary workaround, users may still create a new ticket at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/s/

We apologize for the inconvenience and will post an update as soon as further information is available.

As of 01:00 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue impacting our managed Kubernetes service in the NYC3 region. All operations for clusters should now be functioning normally.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has deployed a fix for the issue impacting our Managed Kubernetes service in the NYC3 region. As of 17:50 UTC, all impact has been mitigated and users should no longer experience any issues with our managed Kubernetes service in the NYC3 region. We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once the incident is completely resolved.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with Kubernetes clusters in the NYC3 region. During this time, a subset of users will experience errors while communicating with their clusters in the NYC3 region. Specifically, as of 14:10 UTC, users will be unable to load the Kubernetes Dashboard in the Cloud Control Panel, see errors when accessing via kubectl, and/or see unauthorized/500 errors when attempting to establish connectivity. 

Any prior workloads running on the cluster are not affected by this incident. Users will not be able to deploy new workloads.

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

From 19:07 UTC to 19:21 UTC, our Engineering team observed connectivity issues impacting the Cloud Control Panel and API. During this time, users may have experienced trouble accessing the Cloud Control Panel through their web browser and performing actions with the API. Our Engineering team has identified the cause and resolved the issue impacting these services. Users should no longer be experiencing connectivity issues with the Cloud Control Panel or API.

If you are still experiencing any problems or have additional questions, please open a support ticket within your account. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

From 09:05 - 11:57 UTC, we experienced a networking issue in our BLR1 region. We initially believed the issue was due to the ongoing performance issues with the APAC fiber faults, but further investigation from our Network Engineering team revealed this was a separate issue.

The root cause was tracked to an unexpected hardware issue that resulted in network unavailability for a large subset of services in the BLR1 region.

User impact included being unable to reach Droplets and Droplet-based services like Kubernetes clusters, Managed Databases, and Load Balancers.

Users with Block Storage Volumes and Snapshots in BLR1 also experienced intermittent failures with CRUD (create, read, update, delete) operations. This could have resulted in API errors or errors shown in the Cloud Control Panel when working with those services.

Users utilizing App Platform also saw image pull failures and deployment latency/failures during the course of this incident.

Our Network Engineering team has an open case with our upstream provider in BLR1 to determine the cause behind this hardware failure. We will also be working internally to determine quicker remediation tactics for this type of failure.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has successfully mitigated the issue impacting multiple products in BLR1. At this time, network connectivity to Droplet-based services including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database in BLR1, should be operating normally. 

We'll continue to monitor the situation to confirm this incident is fully resolved and will post an update soon.

As of 09:05UTC, our Engineering team is currently investigating an issue impacting multiple products in the BLR1 region. During this time, users may have experienced packet loss/latency, timeouts, and related issues with Droplet-based services in these regions, including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database. We will share an update once we have further information.

After further investigation, our Engineering team has discovered that monitoring alerts, other than disk usage, have been triggering correctly for MongoDB clusters, but have been missing cluster information, such as the name of the cluster in the email subject line.

Additionally, there is a known issue with disk usage alerts for MongoDB clusters that has been present since the launch of the product.

A small number of clusters are impacted. We apologize for any miscommunication and misunderstanding. At the outset of this incident, with the data available, we believed this to be much more impactful.

Our Engineering team will work to correct the missing cluster information in triggered alerts to improve the customer experience. Longer-term work is planned to allow for successful disk alerts for MongoDB clusters as well. Given this, we’ll close this public incident.
If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to Support from within your account. Thank you.

As of 13:35 UTC, our Engineering team has identified the issue with Monitoring alerts for MongoDB Clusters and is working on a fix. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with Monitoring alerts for MongoDB Clusters in all region. During this time, alert policies may be delayed or fail to trigger their configured notification options. We apologize for the inconvenience, and we'll share an update once we have more information.

incidents.name: Network connectivity in FRA1 and AMS3 regions

incident_updates.body:
Our Engineering and Datacenter Operations teams have confirmed that the implemented fixes have successfully resolved the traffic latency and packet loss in the FRA1 and AMS3 regions.

From 07:04 - 13:53 UTC, Droplet-based services in FRA1 and AMS3 experienced network connectivity issues, App Platform deploys were delayed in all regions, and image pulls from the Container Registry intermittently failed. 

This was due to a networking hardware issue, which was resolved by our teams rotating out faulty hardware. 

If you continue to experience any issues in relation to this incident please open a ticket with our support team. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering and Datacenter Operations teams have successfully mitigated the issue with network connectivity in FRA1 and AMS3 and we've confirmed traffic latency and packet loss has returned to pre-incident levels. At this time, network connectivity to Droplet-based services in FRA1 and AMS3, as well as App Platform Deploys and Container Registry pulls, should be operating normally. 

We'll continue to monitor the situation to confirm this incident is fully resolved and will post an update soon.

Our Engineering team is continuing to work on a fix. Additionally, our Engineering team identified App Platform and Container Registry to be impacted. Users may see issues with pulling images from Container Registry in FRA1 and AMS3 and App deployments. We will share an update as soon as we have further information

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of network issues and is actively working on a fix.

Currently, users of services in the FRA1 and  AMS3 region will continue to experience network issues.

We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

As of 08:43 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating reports of networking connectivity issues in our FRA1 and AMS3 regions. Users may have experienced packet loss/latency, timeouts, and related issues with Droplet-based services in these regions, including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database. We will share an update once we have further information.

Our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting App Platform deployments has been fully resolved.  If you continue to experience any issues in relation to this incident please open a ticket with our support team. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering team identified a recurrence of the issue with App Platform identified in a previous incident today: https://status.digitalocean.com/incidents/g37jg4czmpv3

From 18:15 - 18:55 UTC, users would have again experienced delays while updating existing Apps and deploying new Apps.

The team is currently working to fully remediate this recurrence. We will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting App Platform deployments has been fully resolved.  If you continue to experience any issues in relation to this incident please open a ticket with our support team. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering team has deployed a fix for the issue impacting Apps. As of 17:20 UTC, all impact has been mitigated and users should no longer experience any issues when deploying new Apps or updating existing Apps. We're monitoring the situation and will post an update once we resolved the issue.

As of 16:45 UTC, our Engineering team has identified the issue with App Platform deploys and creates in all regions and is working on a fix. Users will experience delays while updating existing Apps and deploying new Apps. We apologize for the inconvenience and will post an update as soon as we have further information.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with App Platform deploys and creates in all regions. Existing running Apps are not impacted.

As of 15:55 UTC, users will experience delays while updating existing Apps and deploying new Apps. We are working to deploy a fix, but are investigating other mitigation avenues to quickly resolve customer impact. 

We will post an update once we have additional information.

incidents.name: Droplet Creation via Cloud Control Panel

incident_updates.body:
From 17:22 - 18:42 UTC, users were unable to create Droplets in the Cloud Control Panel due to an incorrect UI/UX change. The public API remained fully functional. 

We've confirmed this incident is resolved. If you continue to experience any issues, please open a support ticket from within your account. Thank you.

The rollback has completed and we've confirmed the change that we rolled back was the root cause of the issue with creating Droplets from the Cloud Control Panel. Users are able to create Droplets normally at this time. We're now monitoring the situation and will post an update once we confirm this incident is fully resolved.

Our team has identified a probable root cause. We are in the process of rolling back to mitigate the issue as well as confirm the cause of the issue. We'll post an update once the rollback has completed.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with creating Droplets via the Cloud Control Panel. At this time, users may see nothing happening when selecting all options and then attempting to create a Droplet in the control panel. Creation via the public API does not appear to be impacted. We will provide an update as soon as we have further information.

Our team has confirmed the issue with customers being unable to login to our support portal at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/s/ is fully resolved. We sincerely apologize and thank you for your patience as we worked through this issue. 

In case of any questions or concerns, please open a ticket with our Support team.

Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to correct the intermittent errors with the Support Portal and is monitoring the situation. We are working with our vendor to ensure future stability and will post an update once we can confirm full resolution.

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issues causing intermittent errors with the Support Portal and is currently working with our vendor on a fix. We will provide an update as soon as the changes are fully implemented. 

As this issue is intermittent, users may occasionally still see errors when trying to reach support. As a temporary workaround users can still contact us via the form here:
https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

Our Engineering team has observed a recurrence of this incident that intermittently continues to impact our Support portal at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/. We are aware of these events and are working with our vendor to permanently resolve the issue. 

As this issue appears to be intermittent, users may occasionally see errors when trying to connect to the Support portal. As a temporary workaround users can still contact us via the form here:
https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

We will post an update as soon as further information becomes available. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has made additional changes to our Support Portal, We've confirmed that logging in to the portal is working correctly at this time. We're continuing to monitor and work with our vendor to fully resolve this incident. 

If you experience any issues with the Support Portal, please continue to use the form here: https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

Our Engineering team has observed recurrences of this incident and we are in communication with our vendor to find a permanent solution. Some users may continue to experience issues on an intermittent basis while logging into our Support portal at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/. As a temporary workaround, users may still contact us via the form here:
https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

We appreciate your patience and understanding in this process and will keep you posted with further updates in the due course.

Our Engineering team has observed recurring instances of this incident that intermittently continue to impact our Support portal at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com/. We are aware of these events and our engineers are working with our vendor to resolve this. 

As this issue is intermittent, we expect users will be able to log support tickets normally. However, during any periods of unavailability, as a temporary workaround, users may still contact us via the form here: https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

Thank you for your patience. We will post an update as soon as further information becomes available.

As of 01:32 UTC, our Engineering team has observed the reoccurrence of the login issue with our Support Portal and identified that during this time a subset of users may still observe an "Oops, Something Went Wrong" error on the page. As a temporary workaround, users can still contact us via the form here: https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

Our Engineering team is actively working on fixing the issue with Customer Support Ticket Portal. We apologize for the inconvenience and will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the login issue with our Support Portal and is monitoring the situation. 

Customers should now be able to login and create tickets using our Support Portal at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com.

We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with customers being unable to login to our support portal at https://cloudsupport.digitalocean.com. 

At this time, a subset of users may observe an "Oops, Something Went Wrong" error on the page. As a temporary workaround, users may still contact us via the form here: https://www.digitalocean.com/company/contact/support

We apologize for the inconvenience and will post an update as soon as further information is available.

As of 16:57 UTC our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting App Platform deployments has been fully resolved. 
If you continue to experience any issues in relation to this incident please open a ticket with our support team. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering team has confirmed App deploys are functioning normally and users should no longer experience errors when deploying. Any queued deploys are also processing. We're monitoring the situation and will post an update once we receive confirmation from the upstream provider that they have fully resolved the issue.

Our Engineering team has received confirmation from the upstream provider that the issue on their end is starting to recover. We are seeing error rates for App Platform App deploys also recovering and are confident the root cause was the upstream issue. At this time, users should start to be able to deploy normally.

Our Engineering team has confirmed App Platform deploys began experiencing an increased error rate starting 15:52 UTC. Initial investigation suggests there may be an issue with an upstream provider that is causing the deploy failures. The team is reaching out to that provider while continuing to investigate on our end. 

We'll post an update as soon as we have further information. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with App Platform in all regions. At this time, users may experience errors while trying to deploy new or existing Apps. We are working to understand the scope of this incident as well as the root cause and will post an update soon.

Our Engineering team identified and mitigated an issue with an internal service. From 16:13 - 16:20 UTC, users would have experienced an increased error rate for requests to the API. Users may have also seen errors in the Cloud Control Panel, for operations like generating API tokens, downloading configuration files, etc. Our team also confirmed impact to the Functions API.  

A fix was deployed and a long-term remediation plan is also in progress to prevent recurrences of this issue. 

If you continue to experience any issues, please open a support ticket from within your account.

Our Engineering team identified and resolved issues with our Public API. From 12:17 - 12:31 UTC, some users may have observed intermittent issues while using the API, including seeing 500 errors being returned when attempting to send requests. Users may have seen issues while interacting with Managed Kubernetes, Volumes and Load Balancers during that period as well. 

Our team has resolved those issues completely and as of 12:31 UTC, all services should be operating normally.

We apologize for the inconvenience. If you are still experiencing any problems or have additional questions, then please open a support ticket within your account.

We've confirmed no recurrence of errors or latency for Container Registry and App Platform deploys. This incident is fully resolved. 

If you continue to experience issues, please open a Support ticket from within your account.

The routing changes made by our Networking team have been confirmed to have successfully improved error rates and latency. We are now seeing successful App Platform deployments, as well as pre-incident latency levels for pulling images from Container Registry. 

We will continue to monitor for a short period of time and post an update when we confirm the situation is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with Container Registry and App Platform deploys, beginning around 01:30 UTC. 

Users attempting to pull images with Container Registry or deploy apps with App Platform may be experiencing latency or failures. 

Our Networking team has made some preliminary routing changes to attempt to improve latency and error rates. We continue to investigate and are monitoring the routing changes for signs of improvement. 

We will share an update once we have further information.

Our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue impacting our Load Balancer services and Reserved IPs in the NYC1 region. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has also confirmed impact to Reserved IP addresses during this time. Users might have experienced issues adding Reserved IP addresses in the NYC1 region.
As of 08:35 UTC, the Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue impacting Load Balancer creation and adding Reserved IP addresses in the NYC1 region.
We're now monitoring and will post an update once we confirm this issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue impacting Load Balancer creation in the NYC1 region. At this time, users will continue to experience issues creating new Load Balancers in NYC1 region.
We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information

As of 06:25 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting Load Balancer creation in the NYC1 region. During this time, users may experience issues creating new Load Balancers in NYC1 region. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

Our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting App Platform CDN metrics is resolved and functioning normally at this time. Thank you for your patience, and please reach out to Support if you experience any further issues at all.

Our upstream provider has implemented a fix to resolve the issue impacting App Platform CDN metrics and our Engineers are monitoring the situation closely. We will post a final update once we're confident that the issue is fully resolved.

As of 21:13 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating an issue with AppPlatform CDN metrics being unavailable in the Cloud Control Panel. Users may observe empty graphs or "No Data" for CDN-related metrics. AppPlatform and CDN remain fully functional at this time. 
Our Engineers are actively engaged with an upstream provider to find a fix. We will share an update as soon as possible.

Our Engineering team has resolved an issue that intermittently impacted Spaces, App Platform deploys/updates, and DigitalOcean Container Registry between the 6th of February 18:56 UTC, and the 7th of February 07:02 UTC.  Users should no longer experience slowness or timeouts when accessing or managing their resources in the FRA1 region.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has implemented a permanent fix and continuing to monitor the issue with Spaces availability in the FRA1 region. Users should now be able to access or manage their Spaces buckets without any problem. 

We will post an update as soon full resolution of the issue can be confirmed.

Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with Spaces availability in the FRA1 region and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon full resolution of the issue can be confirmed.

Our Engineering team continues to investigate this issue, but they've put in place some mitigations and we're observing availability recovering. As of now, overall availability is back to pre-incident levels. 

Users should be able to utilize Spaces normally at this time.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting Spaces availability in our FRA1 region. As of 18:56 UTC, we're experiencing about 70% overall availability for Spaces in FRA1, so some users may experience latency or timeouts when trying to access or manage their Spaces buckets. 

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

Our Engineering team has confirmed full resolution of this incident. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

From 13:32 to 13:49 UTC, users may have encountered event processing failures for Droplets and associated services, such as creating, destroying, and snapshotting. The issue has now been resolved, and all new events are being processed without any issues. We are closely monitoring the situation and will provide an update once it has been fully resolved.

From 16:47 to 17:35 UTC, some users may have experienced intermittent failures in accessing Spaces in the NYC3 region. However, our team has fully resolved the issues and as of 17:35 UTC, all services should be functioning normally.

We apologize for the inconvenience. If you are still experiencing any problems or have additional questions, then please open a support ticket within your account.

Our Engineering team has confirmed all stuck events have been cleared as of 15:24 UTC. All users are now able to process events normally for Droplets and Droplet-based services. Thank you for your patience. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

From 14:13 - 14:24 UTC, an internal networking issue disrupted event processing for users in FRA1. During that time, users would have experienced event processing failures for Droplets and Droplet-based services, including actions like create, destroy, snapshot, etc.  

The issue has been resolved and new events are succeeding normally. We are working to identify and clear any lingering stuck events.

From 20:20 - 23:25, we experienced a partial outage of VPC traffic in our LON1 region. This outage was triggered by an underlying bug uncovered by the maintenance activities in https://status.digitalocean.com/incidents/pqsgdmyzyy0k. 

Public networking was unaffected, but Load Balancers, Managed Kubernetes Clusters, Managed Databases, App Platform, Functions, and Droplet-to-Droplet traffic flowing via VPC was impacted. 

We sincerely apologize for the disruption triggered by the maintenance activities we performed. We've successfully run this maintenance in multiple regions without any impact, but going forward, we will ensure the bug discovered here is not present before rolling out the upgrades to the remaining regions.

Our Engineering team has confirmed the mitigation was successful and traffic is flowing normally again. Services dependent on VPC traffic were impacted, which include Load Balancers, Managed Databases, Managed Kubernetes Clusters, App Platform, and Functions. We've also confirmed the impact from this outage was triggered by the activities in the maintenance here: https://status.digitalocean.com/incidents/pqsgdmyzyy0k

We're now monitoring and will post an update once we confirm this issue is fully resolved.

Mitigation efforts are now 100% complete and we are seeing restoration of connectivity. We're confirming with multiple Engineering teams that the mitigation was successful and will post an update soon.
Our Engineering team has identified the root cause of the issue and is now mitigating it. These efforts are approximately 35% complete. We'll continue to post updates.
Our Engineering team has confirmed impact to Load Balancers, Managed Databases, Managed Kubernetes Clusters, and App Platform. Connectivity directly to Droplets does not appear to be affected.

Our Engineering team is currently investigating reports of connectivity issues in our LON1 region. Maintenance is ongoing as per https://status.digitalocean.com/incidents/pqsgdmyzyy0k and we are working to determine if the root cause is related to that maintenance. At this time, users may see timeouts and errors when connecting to services in LON1. 

We'll post an update with further information as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Spaces Creation from Cloud Control Panel

incident_updates.body:
As of 01:33 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue impacting the creation of Spaces via the Cloud Control Panel. 

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

As of 01:00 UTC, our Engineering team has implemented a fix for the issues impacting the Spaces creation using the Cloud Control Panel.

We're now monitoring the situation closely. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

As of 22:40 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating an issue with creating Spaces buckets using the Cloud Control Panel. Users may experience a "422 error" when attempting to create a Spaces Bucket from the create menu. 

During this time, users should still be able to create the Spaces Bucket using API. So we encourage users to create the Space using the API until a fix is put in place.

We will share an update as soon as possible.

From 20:32 - 20:52 UTC, users were unable to load Droplet and Volume paths in the Cloud Control Panel, as well as saw operations on Volumes failing, due to errors on the Volumes API.

We've confirmed full resolution of this incident and all services are functioning normally.

If you continue to experience issues or have any questions, please open a Support ticket from within your account.

Our Engineering team has confirmed the change has been reverted and all impact should now be mitigated. We are observing recovery and error rates dropping back to normal levels. At this time, users should be able to use both the Volumes API and the Cloud Control Panel normally. 

We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

Additional confirmed impact: 

Users are unable to utilize the Volumes API, resulting in failures on CRUD (create, read, update, delete) operations for Volumes. Users will experience 500 errors via the API when attempting operations like create, attach, detach, delete, etc. Users with Kubernetes Clusters utilizing Volumes for storage will also see errors when attempting these operations.

Our Engineering team has confirmed the root cause of this issue to be an incorrect DNS change and is in the process of rolling that change back to mitigate impact. We've also confirmed users may experience the error when attempting to load the Networking tab in the Cloud Control Panel. 

We will post an update as soon as the change has been reverted.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting loading of the Droplets and Volumes pages in the Cloud Control Panel. At this time, users will experience a "Looks like something went wrong..." error when attempting to visit the Droplets or Volumes tab, as well as when attempting to create Droplets or Volumes. 

We will provide an update as soon as possible.

Our Engineering team identified and resolved issues with a subset of App Platform Apps. From 07:00 - 14:51 UTC, users may have observed failures while deploying and building new applications.

Our team has resolved those issues completely and as of 14:51 UTC, all  services should be operating normally.

We apologize for the inconvenience. If you are still experiencing any problems or have additional questions, then please open a support ticket within your account.

As of 05:30 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed with our upstream providers that they have been able to mitigate the network connectivity issues in the BLR1 region.

At this time users should not experience intermittent degraded performance and timeout errors with Droplet-based services to and from the BLR1 region. 

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team is continuing to work with upstream providers to fix the network connectivity issues we are experiencing in the BLR1 region. The problems appear to be a direct result of multiple subsea fiber faults in the APAC region causing congestion resulting in packet loss and increased latency connecting to the BLR1 region, especially on US <-> BLR bi-directional routes.

At this time users will continue experiencing intermittent degraded performance including timeout errors with Droplet-based services in the BLR1 region. We do not have a firm ETA for resolution time but we will provide updates as needed. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our team is continuing to work on a fix for this issue. We will provide an update in the due course along with more information about this problem. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.

Our Engineering team has identified an issue with an upstream provider causing packet loss and increased latency in the BLR1 region. Users may have been experiencing degraded performance including timeout errors with Droplet-based services in BLR1. Please note that the concerned team is actually working on a fix and we will share an update once we have further information.

As of 08:40 UTC, our Engineering team is continuing to investigate an issue with network connectivity to services in the BLR1 region due to packet loss/latency on our Network provider's end. 

At this time, users may experience issues with elevated packet loss to Droplets and other services hosted in BLR1 as well as Droplet create failures.

We apologize for the inconvenience and will post an update once we have more information.

Our engineering team is investigating an issue with network connectivity to services in the BLR1 region. At this time, users may experience issues with elevated packet loss to Droplets and other services hosted in BLR1 as well as Droplet create failures. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 10:41 UTC, our Engineering team has resolved the issue impacting Spaces availability in our NYC3 region. Users should no longer experience slowness or timeouts when trying to access or manage their Spaces resources in the NYC3 region. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience

Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue impacting Spaces availability in our NYC3 region and is monitoring the situation. 

Users should no longer experience slowness or timeouts when trying to access or manage their Spaces resources in NYC3.

We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

As of 06:03 UTC, our Engineering team is currently investigating an issue impacting Spaces availability in our NYC3 region. During this time, some users may experience slowness or timeouts when trying to access or manage their Spaces resources in NYC3. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

incidents.name: Cloud Control Panel and Multiple services

incident_updates.body:
# The Incident

‌

Beginning at 04:58 UTC, January 29th, the DigitalOcean NYC3 data center region experienced an Internet connection outage. This prevented Droplets and Droplet-based services, App Platform, Load Balancers, and Spaces in that data center region from accessing the Internet during the outages. Additionally, users were unable to access the Cloud Control Panel and the DigitalOcean API during the outage and event processing failures were evident in all regions. Customers may have also seen some gaps in metrics and monitoring during the incident. This incident was triggered by a software bug in the border \(edge\) routers of the NYC3 region.

‌

Our engineers were able to detect and begin an incident response for this issue within minutes of the first signs of impact. We quickly determined the root cause and began remediation efforts.

‌

The root cause was discovered to be a bug in the operating system software of critical edge routing hardware, causing these routing systems to crash. The bug was triggered by interpretation of automatically propagated routes. Routers propagate routing information between redundant nodes as efficiently as possible to avoid errors. This behavior of standard routing protocols, coupled with the bug, caused clustered routers to crash nearly concurrently.

‌

Without the routing service, the edge routers quickly degraded and stopped serving traffic. This cut off the DigitalOcean network behind the edge routers in question from the rest of the Internet during these crashes. Besides impact to customers, the lack of external network access complicated efforts to troubleshoot and fix problems and spread secondary impacts to nearly all DigitalOcean services. The core problem occurred in three waves. The initial outage consisted of 16 minutes of Internet connectivity loss, followed by two 15-minute periods of network congestion, and finally 50 minutes of congestion, as traffic was redirected to perform software upgrades.

‌

To fix this issue, DigitalOcean engineers deployed emergency software upgrades to the impacted systems. These upgrades were the most time-consuming part of the response and, when completed, they resolved the bug in the impacted systems for the long term. Internet access at the expected performance levels was restored for Cloud, API, Droplets, Droplet-based services like Managed Kubernetes and Load Balancers, App Platform, Functions, Monitoring, and Spaces by the end of the emergency software upgrades. Some asynchronous customer-triggered events like power offs and resizes were stuck until DigitalOcean engineers completed manual cleanup of affected events after the incident.

# Timeline of Events

‌

**UTC Timeline**  
  
04:58 - Both edge routers crash in NYC3, causing a complete outage for NYC3 for customer and internal services, as well as global impact to some services.05:05 - Internal incident response begins.

05:12 - Network Engineering team gains access to the edge routers in NYC3 and begins investigation.

05:13 - Network Engineering team sees the routing process crashed.

05:14 - Edge1 recovered and took traffic. Complete outage ends, congestion exists for customer and internal services.

05:21 - Multiple Engineering teams across DigitalOcean still reporting down alerts. Network Engineering team sees that memory is exhausted on Edge2.

05:27 - Multiple Engineering teams confirm alerts are clearing and that [cloud.digitalocean.com](http://cloud.digitalocean.com) is accessible again.

05:40 - Edge2 recovered after manual intervention caused by hardware failure. Congestion ends for customer and internal services.

06:06 - Public status page posted with information about the outage .

06:24 - Edge1 crashes for a second time, causing customers to be unable to access or experience latency with Droplets and Droplet-based services via public/private networks.

06:36 - Network Engineering team makes the decision to emergency upgrade software on Edge1 to a newer version to help mitigate the crashes.

06:41 - Edge1 recovers and is able to take traffic again.

06:52 - Edge2 crashes for a second time, causing customers to be unable to access or experience latency with Droplets and Droplet-based services via public/private networks.

06:59 - Network Engineering team confirms Edge2 needs to recover before starting the software upgrade for Edge1.

07:07 - Edge2 recovered and took traffic.

07:08 - Network Engineering team begins to drain traffic away from Edge1 in preparation for upgrade. Congestion to Droplets and Droplet-based services in NYC3 begins.

07:23 - Edge1 is rebooted to apply the software upgrade.

07:44 - Network Engineering team brings Edge1 online and it begins to take traffic.

07:56 - Edge1 upgrade complete, traffic restored. Congestion ends.

08:09 - Network Engineering team begins to drain traffic away from Edge2 in preparation for upgrade. Congestion to Droplets and Droplet-based services in NYC3 begins.

08:18 - Edge2 is rebooted to apply the software upgrade.

09:05 - Network Engineering team confirms both edge routers are upgraded and traffic is balanced between them. All customer impact confirmed over.

# Future Measures

The current and ongoing network infrastructure upgrade scheduled to be completed in the first half of 2023 aims to improve overall network performance and stability. As of today, SYD1, SGP1, and BLR1 are the completed regions for this overarching upgrade and are running on the new network infrastructure.

‌

As a result of these upgrades, users can expect a smoother and more efficient experience when using the network by increasing bandwidth and enhancing availability. To achieve this, the upgrade utilizes updated hardware and software, fixing any bugs that existed in the previous network setup.

‌

In addition to the immediate benefits, there is a long-term plan to address potential vulnerabilities. This includes a proof of concept, scheduled for 2023, which focuses on implementing vendor diversity. This strategy will reduce the reliance on a single vendor, which can be a source of single point of failure. Reliance on a single vendor was a factor in this incident and the other routing crashes we experienced, as the software on the edge routers is from a single vendor. By diversifying vendors, the likelihood of a similar failure in the future is significantly reduced, ensuring the stability and reliability of the network for years to come.

‌

# In Conclusion

DigitalOcean recognizes and understands how disruptive networking incidents are to our customers and that repeated networking outages erode customer trust, as well as lead to business impact for our users. We let our users down and are working to earn customer trust back by taking steps to improve our networking stack as a whole, as well as reduce single points of failure in our networking vendor and in DigitalOcean internal services.

‌

We’re committed to being as transparent as possible as networking upgrades happen and will communicate with users to ensure they can plan appropriately. We are also reviewing all deployment processes at DigitalOcean to ensure sufficient testing is done before any production change. DigitalOcean is confident in our commitment to excellence and that the future measures we’ve identified will drive better and better outcomes for our users.

As of 10:00 UTC, our Engineering team has resolved the issue with the Cloud Control panel, services in the NYC3 region, Functions, Container registry, and Event processing in all the regions should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Around 04:58UTC, our Engineering team observed issues with the Cloud Control panel, services in the NYC3 region, Functions, Container registry, and Event processing in all the regions. Our Engineering team has mitigated these issues as of 05:12 UTC and currently monitoring the same. The users should no longer experience issues with the Cloud Control panel, Functions, Container Registry, and Event processing, and all the services in the NYC3 region will be functional. We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team has confirmed that the fix put in place to reduce packet-loss and latency in the SGP1 region has successfully resolved the issue. All services and resources should now be fully reachable. If you continue to experience problems please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

Our Engineering team has identified an issue with an upstream provider causing packet-loss and increased latency in the SGP1 region. The team has implemented a fix to reroute traffic and restore connectivity. Between approximately 14:12 UTC and 17:22 UTC, users may have experienced missing metrics on their resource graphs, delays in loading the Volumes page on the cloud panel, and errors trying to create new Volumes. We are continuing to monitor the situation and will provide another update as soon as we confirm the situation is fully resolved. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

incidents.name: Block Storage Volume creations in SGP1

incident_updates.body: As of 07:40 UTC, our Engineering team has resolved the issue with Block Storage Volumes in the SGP1 region. Users should now be able to create Volumes normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with Block Storage Volumes in the SGP1 region and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with Block Storage Volumes in the SGP1 region and is actively working on a fix. During this time, users may experience intermittent issues creating new Volumes but existing Volumes are fully operational. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

Our engineering team is investigating an issue with Block Storage Volumes in the SGP1 region. Beginning 04:44 UTC, users may experience intermittent issues creating new Volumes but existing Volumes are fully operational. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 23:40 UTC, We've confirmed the issue impacting the API and Cloud Control Panel is fully resolved. Thank you for your patience. If you continue to experience any problems, please open a support ticket from within your account.

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with our Cloud Control Panel and API. As of 22:58 UTC, users should no longer be experiencing errors with loading Cloud or issuing API requests. We are monitoring the situation to ensure there is no recurrence. 

We will post another update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with our Cloud Control Panel and API. Beginning at approximately 22:40 UTC, users may be experiencing intermittent issues with loading the Cloud Control Panel and issuing API requests. 

We will share an update as soon as we have more information.

As of 14:10 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed full resolution of the issue that impacted the reachability of App Platform URLs. All services should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.
Our Engineering team has observed normal resolution of new App Platform URLs and are monitoring the situation closely. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

As of 10:30UTC, our Engineering team is currently investigating an issue with App Platform URLs not resolving correctly for any newly deployed Apps. Existing Apps should not face any issues. 

At this time, users may experience inaccessibility with App Platform URLs. Unfortunately, adding custom domains currently for the impacted Apps is also affected and cannot be used as a workaround.

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 08:17 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating an issue with App Platform URLs not resolving correctly for any newly deployed Apps. Existing Apps should not face any issues. 

At this time, users may experience inaccessibility with App Platform URLs. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 10:00 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue that impacted network reachability in the SGP1 region. All services and resources should now be fully reachable.
If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

Our Engineering team has been able to mitigate the issue with networking in our SGP1 region. Users in the region should no longer experience packet loss/latency, timeouts, and related issues with Droplet-based services in SGP1, including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database.
We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team has identified that our Network providers are experiencing packet loss/ latency on their end and we have implemented workarounds for this issue. Users in the region may experience packet loss/latency, timeouts, and related issues with Droplet-based services in SGP1, including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database.
We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

As of 04.30 UTC, our Engineering team is investigating reports of networking connectivity issues in our SGP1 region. Users from the North American region may have experienced packet loss/latency, timeouts, and related issues with Droplet-based services in SGP1, including Droplets, Managed Kubernetes, and Managed Database. We will share an update once we have further information.

Our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting payments made on the DigitalOcean platform has been fully resolved. Between 08:00 UTC and 15:34 UTC customer accounts may have been temporarily suspended even after successful payment of their monthly bill was remitted.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has put a fix in place for the issue impacting payments made on the DigitalOcean platform. At this time users should no longer experience any issues with Accounts being suspended after successful payment remittance. We will continue to monitor the situation and provide a final update once we confirm the issue has been fully resolved. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with payments made on the DigitalOcean platform and is actively working on a fix. During this time, users may experience issues with Accounts being suspended even after successful payment. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with payments made on the DigitalOcean platform. As of 08:00 UTC, users may experience issues with Accounts being suspended even after successful payment. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

incidents.name: Networking and Event Processing in LON1 and SFO3

incident_updates.body:
As of 02:45 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue that impacted network reachability and event processing in the LON1 and SFO3 regions. All services and resources should now be fully reachable and operational.
If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

After further investigation, our Engineering teams have confirmed there was a concurrent event in SFO3 which caused impact to our internal network. This resulted in multiple monitoring systems alerting, as well as impacted users trying to perform events in SFO3, such as Droplet creates, power on/off, etc. 

Confirmed impact: 

01:35 - 01:50 UTC: Network connectivity loss in LON1 to Droplets and Droplet-based services like Managed Databases, Load Balancers, and Kubernetes Clusters, as well as unavailability to App Platform Apps and Functions. Users were also unable to perform events in LON1 during this time. 

01:32 - 01:40 UTC: Users unable to perform events in SFO3 during this time. 

All services are now operating normally and we will update the title of this incident to accurately reflect this outage. 

We appreciate your patience and will post an update once we are confident the issue is fully resolved.

Our Network Engineering team has confirmed an unexpected issue occurred in our LON1 region, which led to a loss of network connectivity in LON1 from 01:35 - 01:56 UTC. Network traffic began to recover at 01:56 UTC to all services in LON1. 

We are continuing to investigate impact in other regions and will post an update soon.

At approximately 01:36 UTC, we received multiple alerts for services in multiple regions. So far, we've confirmed issues in LON1, NYC1, NYC3, SFO2, SFO3, AMS3, and FRA1. We are working to determine impact and are seeing some services self-recovering. 

Users may have experienced and may still be experiencing issues with network connectivity to Droplets and Droplet-based services, event failures like Droplet creates and power on/off, Functions unavailability, and other issues with DigitalOcean services. 

As soon as we have further information to share, we'll post an update here.

As of 06:51 UTC, our Engineering team has resolved the issue with Spaces in our AMS3 region. The Spaces system should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.
Our engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with Spaces in our AMS3 region and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with Spaces in our AMS3 region and is actively working on a fix. During this time, users may experience issues with accessing Spaces and see request errors. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with Spaces in our AMS3 region. As of 20:44 UTC, users may experience issues with accessing Spaces and see request errors. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 13:53 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue that impacted Kubernetes Clusters in our AMS3 region. All resources should now be fully reachable.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our Support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has successfully mitigated the issue and the remaining clusters have been remediated.

At this time, all Kubernetes Clusters which were affected in AMS3 are operational. Users should be able to access their Kubernetes Clusters without any problem. 

We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

As of 10:00 UTC January 18, our Engineering team has made progress toward internal recovery, although it might take some time for the Clusters to be fully operational and accessible. Some Kubernetes Clusters in AMS3 remain impacted and may be inaccessible. Our Engineering team is continuing to work to mitigate the issue as soon as possible.

We will post another update as soon as we have new developments.

As of 09:00 UTC January 18, our Engineering team has made progress toward internal recovery, although it might take some time for the Clusters to be fully operational and accessible. 

At this point, 7% out of the total 21% of Kubernetes Clusters have been remediated and approximately 14% of Kubernetes Clusters in AMS3 remain impacted and may be inaccessible. Our Engineering team is continuing to work to mitigate the issue as soon as possible.

We will post another update by 10:00 UTC.

Our Engineering team has continued work to mitigate this issue and additional clusters have been remediated. 

The total percentage of Kubernetes Clusters impacted by this incident was determined to be approximately 21%. 

From 11:41 - 18:00 UTC January 17, approximately 7% out of the total 21% of Kubernetes Clusters in AMS3 experienced issues and were remediated.  

At this point, approximately 14% of Kubernetes Clusters in AMS3 remain impacted and may be inaccessible. 

We will post another update by 09:00 UTC.

Our Engineering team is continuing to troubleshoot this issue with the main priority of getting Kubernetes clusters available for users. A fix has now been pushed for a subset of clusters. Unfortunately, there are still some clusters that remain impacted at this time and users could still be facing issues with loading the dashboard as well as cluster accessibility.

We will provide further updates as investigation and mitigation efforts continue. Thank you for your patience.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with Kubernetes clusters in the AMS3 region. During this time, a subset of users may experience errors while communicating with their clusters in the AMS3 region. Specifically, as of 00:18 UTC, users may be unable to load the Kubernetes Dashboard in the Cloud Control Panel, see errors when accessing via kubectl, and/or see unauthorized errors when attempting to establish connectivity. 

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

As of 06:00 UTC, our Engineering team has confirmed the full resolution of the issue that impacted network reachability in the TOR1 region. All services and resources should now be fully reachable.
If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has mitigated an issue that impacted network connectivity to the TOR1 region. Between 2:16  - 2:48 UTC, users may have noticed network connectivity issues with Droplets and Droplet-based services, in the region. 

We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with network connectivity in our TOR1 region, beginning at 02:16 UTC. At this time, users may see high amounts of packet loss, network timeouts, or increased latency to Droplets and Droplet-based services.

Our Engineering team has confirmed that the issue impacting network connectivity in the SGP1 region has been fully resolved. Customers may have encountered packet loss, network timeouts, or increased latency between 18:34 UTC - 18:49 UTC.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has identified the root cause of the network connectivity issues in SGP1 and applied a fix. We will continue to monitor for stability and provide a final update once we confirm that the situation is fully resolved. 

Thank you for your patience and we apologize for the inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has determined that this issue is isolated to the SGP1 region and has not impacted any customers in the BLR1 region. Our metrics indicate that the connection issues subsided at 18:49 UTC, however we are continuing to investigate the root cause and will provide an update as soon as more information is available.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with network connectivity in our SGP1 and BLR1 region, beginning 18:41 UTC. At this time, users may see high amounts of packet loss, network timeouts, or increased latency to Droplets and Droplet-based services. 

We'll post an update as soon as we have further information.

Our Engineering team has confirmed full resolution of the issue that impacted network reachability in our TOR1 region. All services and resources should now be fully reachable. 

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has identified an issue that impacted network connectivity to the TOR1 region. Between 16:24  - 17:01 UTC, users may have noticed network reachability issues to Droplets and Droplet-based services, like Managed Kubernetes and  Database Clusters. The team has observed network stability after the initial outage.

We are monitoring the situation and will post an update once we confirm the issue is fully resolved.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with network connectivity in our TOR1 region, beginning 16:24 UTC. At this time, users may see high amounts of packet loss, network timeouts, or increased latency to Droplets and Droplet-based services. 

We'll post an update as soon as we have further information.

Our Networking team has decided to reschedule the maintenance that affected multiple services in the NYC1 region. 

We observed no recurrences nor did we identify any additional impact outside of our initial update. All services in the NYC1 region are now functioning normally.

If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel. Thank you for your patience and we apologize for any inconvenience.

Our Engineering team has identified the root cause of the issue to be the networking maintenance that is being performed in the NYC1 region. Progress of the networking maintenance can be tracked here: https://status.digitalocean.com/incidents/l8zflq8n11fm

We will be continuing this maintenance as planned and will be actively monitoring to ensure minimal impact.

Thank you and we apologize for the unexpected impact, as well as appreciate your patience as we work to complete this maintenance event.

Our Engineering team is investigating an issue beginning at 01:33 UTC. At this time, we've observed recovery of services, but between 01:33 - 01:40 UTC, users may have experienced errors with multiple services. 

We are still working to determine the root cause and the full scope of impact, but have confirmed errors occurred with reaching the Cloud Control Panel, event processing, traffic to some DigitalOcean web endpoints, and network connectivity to Droplets and Droplet-based services in NYC1. 

We will post an update with further information as soon as possible.
